segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 48
5. Jarāvagga
44. Pubbakoṭṭhakasutta
Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati pubbakoṭṭhake.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in Sāvatthī at the eastern gate.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ sāriputtaṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta:

segments.pli: “saddahasi tvaṃ, sāriputta—
saddhindriyaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ amatogadhaṃ hoti amataparāyaṇaṃ amatapariyosānaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ amatogadhaṃ hoti amataparāyaṇaṃ amatapariyosānan”ti?
segments.en: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom, when developed and cultivated, culminate, finish, and end in the deathless?”

segments.pli: “Na khvāhaṃ ettha, bhante, bhagavato saddhāya gacchāmi—
segments.en: “Sir, in this case I don’t rely on faith in the Buddha’s claim that

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ amatogadhaṃ hoti amataparāyaṇaṃ amatapariyosānaṃ.
segments.en: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom, when developed and cultivated, culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.

segments.pli: Yesañhetaṃ, bhante, aññātaṃ assa adiṭṭhaṃ aviditaṃ asacchikataṃ aphassitaṃ paññāya, te tattha paresaṃ saddhāya gaccheyyuṃ—
segments.en: There are those who have not known or seen or understood or realized or experienced this with wisdom. They may rely on faith in this matter.

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ amatogadhaṃ hoti amataparāyaṇaṃ amatapariyosānaṃ.
Yesañca kho etaṃ, bhante, ñātaṃ diṭṭhaṃ viditaṃ sacchikataṃ phassitaṃ paññāya, nikkaṅkhā te tattha nibbicikicchā—
segments.en: But there are those who have known, seen, understood, realized, and experienced this with wisdom. They have no doubts or uncertainties in this matter.

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ amatogadhaṃ hoti amataparāyaṇaṃ amatapariyosānaṃ.
Mayhañca kho etaṃ, bhante, ñātaṃ diṭṭhaṃ viditaṃ sacchikataṃ phassitaṃ paññāya.
segments.en: I have known, seen, understood, realized, and experienced this with wisdom.

segments.pli: Nikkaṅkhvāhaṃ tattha nibbicikiccho saddhindriyaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ amatogadhaṃ hoti amataparāyaṇaṃ amatapariyosānan”ti.
segments.en: I have no doubts or uncertainties that the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom, when developed and cultivated, culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, sāriputta.
Yesañhetaṃ, sāriputta, aññātaṃ assa adiṭṭhaṃ aviditaṃ asacchikataṃ aphassitaṃ paññāya, te tattha paresaṃ saddhāya gaccheyyuṃ—
segments.en: There are those who have not known or seen or understood or realized or experienced this with wisdom. They may rely on faith in this matter.

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ amatogadhaṃ hoti amataparāyaṇaṃ amatapariyosānaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ amatogadhaṃ hoti amataparāyaṇaṃ amatapariyosānaṃ.
Yesañca kho etaṃ, sāriputta, ñātaṃ diṭṭhaṃ viditaṃ sacchikataṃ phassitaṃ paññāya, nikkaṅkhā te tattha nibbicikicchā—
segments.en: But there are those who have known, seen, understood, realized, and experienced this with wisdom. They have no doubts or uncertainties that

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ amatogadhaṃ hoti amataparāyaṇaṃ amatapariyosānaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ bhāvitaṃ bahulīkataṃ amatogadhaṃ hoti amataparāyaṇaṃ amatapariyosānan”ti.
segments.en: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom, when developed and cultivated, culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Sāriputta does not rely on faith in saying that the five faculties lead to the deathless, for he has seen this for himself.
